thread.title: George Osborne: Councils to keep £26bn business rates
thread.title_full: George Osborne: Councils to keep £26bn business rates - BBC News

author: BBC
title: George Osborne: Councils to keep £26bn business rates
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device
George Osborne: Councils to keep £26bn business rates 5 October 2015 Last updated at 16:15 BST
Chancellor George Osborne has announced that local councils in England will be able to set their own business rates and keep the revenue.
He called it the "the biggest transfer of power to local government in living memory".
The move would see £26bn diverted from central government to local government.
Ben Wright reports.
Read more George Osborne: Councils to keep £26bn in business rates
